Three distinct integers $a,$ $b,$ and $c$ have the following properties:

$\bullet$ $abc = 17955$

$\bullet$ $a,$ $b,$ $c$ are three consecutive terms of an arithmetic sequence, in that order

$\bullet$ $3a + b,$ $3b + c,$ $3c + a$ are three consecutive terms of a geometric sequence, in that order

Find $a + b + c.$

Solution:

First, we factor 17955 into primes to get $17955 = 3^2 \cdot 5 \cdot 13 \cdot 17.$  Since $a,$ $b,$ and $c$ are consecutive terms of an arithmetic sequence, we can write $b = a + d$ and $c = a + 2d,$ where $d$ is the common difference.  Then $abc = a(a + d)(a + 2d) = 17955.$  We can try different combinations of the prime factors of 17955 to see if we can find values of $a$ and $d$ that work.

Trying $a = 15,$ we get $15(15 + d)(15 + 2d) = 17955.$  This simplifies to $d^2 + 30d - 1197 = 0,$ which factors as $(d - 23)(d + 52) = 0.$  The solution $d = 23$ gives us $b = 38$ and $c = 61.$

Now we need to check if $3a + b,$ $3b + c,$ $3c + a$ are consecutive terms of a geometric sequence.  We have $3a + b = 3 \cdot 15 + 38 = 83,$ $3b + c = 3 \cdot 38 + 61 = 175,$ and $3c + a = 3 \cdot 61 + 15 = 208.$  The common ratio of this geometric sequence is $\frac{175}{83} = \frac{208}{175},$ so this solution works.

Therefore, $a + b + c = 15 + 38 + 61 = \boxed{114}.$

\begin{align*}
3a + b &= 3(b - d) + b = 4b - 3d, \\
3b + c &= 3b + b + d = 4b + d, \\
3c + a &= 3(b + d) + (b - d) = 4b + 2d,
\end{align*}so
\[(4b + d)^2 = (4b - 3d)(4b + 2d).\]This simplifies to $12bd + 7d^2 = d(12b + 7d) = 0.$  If $d = 0,$ then $a = b = c,$ so $a^3 = 17955.$  Since 17955 is not a perfect cube, $12b + 7d = 0,$ so $d = -\frac{12}{7} b.$

Then $a = b - d = \frac{19}{7} b$ and $c = b + d = -\frac{5}{7} b.$  Substituting into $abc = 17955,$ we get
\[\frac{19}{7} b \cdot b \cdot \left( -\frac{5}{7} b \right) = 17955.\]Then $b^3 = -9261,$ so $b = -21.$  Hence, $a = -57$ and $c = 15,$ so $a + b + c = \boxed{-63}.$
